p: To evaluate the antioxidative potential of the PBWE, we measured its inhibition rate (%) against DPPH radicals. The inhibition rate significantly increased, compared to that in the blank control group, in a dose-dependent manner above the dose of 100 μg/mL of the PBWE ( n = 4 per group, *** p < 0.001; Figure 5a). The inhibition rate in the highest dose (2500 μg/mL) of the PBWE was 83.35%, and the half inhibitory concentration (IC 50) of the PBWE was 403.3 μg/mL as estimated using by the DPPH assay.
